Question
========

Consider the two functions $f$ and $g$, where $g$ is defined as a transformation of $f$, as shown below as an equation true for any value of $x$:

$$g[x]~=~`r exp1`$$

If values $x_{\text{old}}=`r xold[1]`$ and $y_{\text{old}}=`r yold[1]`$ satisfy the equation $y_{\text{old}}=f[x_{\text{old}}]$, we can find corresponding values for $x_{\text{new}}$ and $y_{\text{new}}$ such that $y_{\text{new}}=g[x_{\text{new}}]$. 

* What is the value of $y_{\text{new}}$?


Solution
========

Use the shortcut, which tells us we can make a formula by just looking at the operations outside of the function.

$$y_{\text{new}}~=~`r outex`$$

$$y_{\text{new}}~=~`r outex2`$$

$$y_{\text{new}}~=~`r ynew[1]`$$
